title: Diff in Pres and Parl Systems

content.prompt: Which of the following best explains a key difference between the Mexican presidential system and the British parliamentary system?

choices.label: The Mexican presidential system has to balance national and regional powers, while the British parliamentary system is only concerned with regional powers.

The head of government in the British parliamentary system is usually an unelected king or queen, while the head of government in the Mexican presidential system is always a directly elected president.
The Mexican presidential system has a strong cabinet, while the British parliamentary system has a weak cabinet.

The British parliamentary system has fewer institutional obstacles in passing and enacting policy, while the Mexican presidential system is more likely to face institutional barriers such as checks and balances.
